learning_outcomes.description: Be able to plan, develop and carry out an independent research project.
Obtain an in-depth knowledge of the specific topic area through a thorough literature review.
Develop research skills and be able to locate and use information sources.
Present results of research in a written thesis.
Present results of research in an oral seminar.

assessments.task_description: The mid-year review must be scheduled during Week 2 of Semester 2 2025. Please arrange a time with your supervisor(s) + second grader, and email the Honours Coordinator.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A public talk is to be scheduled during the last teaching week of Semester 2 (Mon 27 to Fri 31 Oct 2025)

Note that the "Honours Project" consists of three components:

  1. A public talk, to be scheduled during the last teaching week of Semester 2 (Mon 27 to Fri 31 Oct 2025)
  2. Thesis submission, due by the first Wednesday of exam week (12 Nov 2025)
  3. Thesis defence (closed door), to be scheduled with your supervisor(s) + second reader by the last Friday of Exam week (21 Nov 2025)

For assessment criteria, see the attached PDF document under criteria and marking.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The Honours Thesis defence (closed door) is to be scheduled with your supervisor(s) + second reader by the last Friday of Exam week. The defence can be scheduled at any time after the submission of the Honours Thesis.

Note that the "Honours Project" consists of three components:

  1. A public talk, to be scheduled during the last teaching week of Semester 2 (Mon 27 to Fri 31 Oct 2025)
  2. Thesis submission, due by the first Wednesday of exam week (12 Nov 2025)
  3. Thesis defence (closed door), to be scheduled with your supervisor(s) + second reader by the last Friday of Exam week (21 Nov 2025)

For assessment criteria, see the attached PDF document under criteria and marking.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: At the end of their two semesters of work, each student submits their honours thesis, the final written report of around 20,000-30,000 words in length. The thesis is to be submitted electronically to the supervisor(s), second reader, honours coordinator, and the school office.
assessments.submission_guidelines: An electronic copy of the thesis must be submitted to each of the following people: (i) the project supervisor(s); (ii) the second reader; (iii) the honours coordinator; (iv) the school administration
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
